frameDefinitions: A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
A Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a Topic, created by an Author at the Time_of_creation.
A Binding_principle, previously only existing as a concept or formulation, enters an 'active' phase or state.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source.

This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the Agent enters an ongoing state of the Activity, remains in this state for some Duration of Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
frameExamples: Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
The new curfew laws <t>kicked in</t> last weekend.
I can't believe he <t>pickpocketed</t> my gold watch !
Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated role for each LU in this frame.
The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.
This role describes the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> which comes into effect.
When the <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Event</fen> takes place.
<fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.
<fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
<fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the theft occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the theft occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> in which the  <fen>Agent</fen>  is engaged.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is engaged in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from the table</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>at dusk</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>in the park</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
